The resulting part should match the provided parameters for the curved rectangular prism.</description>

The dimensions should match the following: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.065 * Height: 0.75 For the extrusion, follow these steps: 1. Set the depth toward the normal: 0.065 2. Set the depth away from the normal: 0.0 3. Apply a scale factor to the sketch: 0.75 This will create a 3D object with the desired dimensions. Part 2 Instructions Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.7189, 0.065, 0.0101] For the sketch, follow these steps: 1. Within loop_1, draw line_2 from point [0.6879, 0.0] to point [0.6879, 0.0199]. 5. Within loop_1, draw line_3 from point [0.6879, 0.0199] to point [0.0, 0.0199]. 6. The dimensions should match the following: * Length: 0.6879 * Width: 0.0111 * Height: 0.6879 For the extrusion, follow these steps: 1. Set the depth toward the normal: 0.0111 2. Set the depth away from the normal: 0.0 3. Apply a scale factor to the sketch: 0.6879 This will create a 3D object with the desired dimensions. Final Shape Instructions Construct a long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism has a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the ends. The sides of the prism are parallel to the X- and Z-axes.
